title: Printer not working
content:
Remote Troubleshooting:

Reboot the printer and wait 2-3 minutes for full initialization

Ping the printer IP address to confirm network connectivity

Check print queue for stuck jobs and clear if necessary

Reinstall printer driver if connectivity is confirmed and necessary

Verify printer status in Windows/system settings

If remote steps fail - Onsite Visit Required:

Check physical connections (power, USB/network cables)

Verify network switch port activity lights

Test with different cable if connection issues persist

Escalation: If hardware replacement is needed or driver issues persist after re-installation

title: Phone not working
content:
Remote Troubleshooting:

Restart 3CX services on server

Check SIP registration status for affected phones

Verify internet connection stability at site

If remote steps fail - Onsite Visit Required:

Check power connections to phone system equipment

Inspect and re-seat all network cables

Test internet connection speed and stability

Power cycle network switches and phone system

Escalation: Required for advanced 3CX configuration issues or Iristel carrier problems. 

Note: Phone issues frequently stem from unstable internet connections.

title: Security camera not working
content:
Remote Troubleshooting:

Reboot the affected camera through NVR interface

Check camera connectivity status in NVR software

Verify PoE switch status for camera's port

If remote steps fail - Onsite Visit Required:

Power cycle the network switch connected to the camera

Check physical cable connections and PoE power delivery

Access NVR system and re-enter camera passwords

Test camera functionality

Escalation: If camera hardware appears faulty or network infrastructure issues are identified

title: Sonos speaker not working
content:
Remote Troubleshooting:

Reboot the speaker using SONOS app

Check speaker's network connection status

Verify speaker appears in SONOS app device list

If remote steps fail - Onsite Visit Required:

Remove and re-add speaker in SONOS app

Check WiFi/network connectivity at speaker location

Update speaker firmware if available

Reset speaker to factory settings if other steps fail

Escalation: If network infrastructure issues are identified or hardware replacement needed

title: No internet/Internet is slow
content:
Common Causes for Internet Issues:

NWtel outages or service problems

Faulty network equipment (modem, router, switch)

Loose or damaged network cables

Network configuration changes

Remote Troubleshooting before going onsite:

Step 1 – Identify Scope

Ask user: “Is it only your computer/phone, or is everyone affected?”

Check Meraki dashboard for:

WAN status (modem/router online).

LAN visibility (are switches and clients reporting in?).

Step 2 – If Single Computer/Phone Only

Attempt remote restart of the device.

Verify network adapter status (enabled, IP assigned).

Release/renew IP address or flush DNS remotely.

Check if device appears in Meraki client list (active DHCP lease, VLAN).

Step 3 – If Multiple Devices Affected

Ping internal resources (server, VoIP phones, other PCs) via Meraki tools.

Check switch status in Meraki (power, uplinks, VLAN).

Review event logs for recent outages or config changes.

Confirm if DHCP server is responding.

Step 4 – Verify with Onsite User

Ask user to check link lights on affected devices (PC, phone).

Lights ON → likely VLAN/DHCP/config issue (may fix remotely).

Lights OFF → likely switch/cabling/power issue (onsite required).

If remote steps fail - Onsite Visit Required:

Step 1 – Power Cycle Equipment (in order)

Unplug modem for 30 seconds, plug back in.

Unplug router for 30 seconds, plug back in.

Unplug network switch for 30 seconds, plug back in.

Step 2 – Physical Checks

Verify all cable connections (Ethernet, coax, power).

Check for loose or damaged cables.

Confirm all devices have proper indicator lights (power, link, activity).

Step 3 – Direct Connection Test

Connect a computer directly to the modem (bypassing router/switch).

Confirm if internet is working directly from the modem.

If yes → problem is internal (router/switch/config).

If no → problem is external (NWtel).

Escalation:

Network equipment configuration issues

NWtel related problems

Complex network infrastructure problems

Hardware replacement needed for networking equipment

title: Outlook not opening
content:
Outlook Issues happen when:

Expired or missing Microsoft 365 licenses

Corrupted Outlook profiles

Account authentication problems

Microsoft 365 service disruptions

Conflicting add-ins or corrupted installation

Remote Troubleshooting:

Check if Outlook process is running in Task Manager - end if stuck

Verify user account sign-in status within Outlook

Check Microsoft 365 Admin Centre for:

User license status and assignment

Service health issues affecting Exchange/Outlook

Account status and any reported issues

Test Outlook in Safe Mode: outlook.exe /safe

Reset user password and attempt sign-in with new credentials

Escalation:

Microsoft 365 tenant-wide issues

Complex Exchange server problems

Licensing issues requiring admin intervention

title: Email not arriving/not sending
content:
Remote Troubleshooting :

Check Microsoft 365 Service Health status first:

Visit admin.microsoft.com or office365status.com

If Microsoft reports issues, inform customer of service disruption and ETA

Monitor for resolution updates from Microsoft

Remote access customer computer and verify email account settings:

Check outgoing email server (SMTP) configuration

Verify correct user account is assigned to outgoing server

Confirm proper port settings (usually 587 or 25 for SMTP)

Ensure IMAP is configured instead of POP3 for better functionality

Test sending/receiving emails to identify specific failure points

Check spam/junk folders for missing incoming emails

Verify email account storage limits haven't been exceeded

If remote steps fail - Advanced Troubleshooting:

Check if hosting provider is blocking emails:

Request IP whitelisting from hosting provider

Verify domain MX records are properly configured

Check for blacklisted IP addresses

Test email flow with different email providers (Gmail, Yahoo, etc.)

Review email client error messages for specific SMTP/IMAP errors

Check firewall settings blocking email ports

Escalation to L3:

GoDaddy hosting issues requiring specialized configuration

Complex DNS/MX record problems

Email server migration or advanced hosting configuration

Persistent delivery issues after basic troubleshooting

Common Causes:

Microsoft 365 service outages or maintenance

Incorrect email server settings (ports, authentication)

POP3 configuration instead of IMAP

Hosting provider IP restrictions

Email account storage limits exceeded

Firewall blocking email ports

GoDaddy-specific configuration issues requiring L3 expertise

title: QuickBooks not opening
content:
Remote Troubleshooting:

Check if issue occurred after recent QuickBooks updates

Download and install latest QuickBooks Enterprise 24.0 from downloads folder

During setup, select:

"Database is stored on this computer"

Use Desktop app option

Restart the server/computer after installation

Launch QuickBooks and change from Single-user mode to Multi-user mode:

Go to File menu → Switch to Multi-user Mode

Test QuickBooks functionality with company file

If remote steps fail - Advanced Troubleshooting:

Download and run QuickBooks Tool Hub:

Use Program Diagnostics Tool within Tool Hub

Run automatic diagnostics and repairs

Run Windows System File Checker:

Open Command Prompt as administrator

Execute: sfc /scannow

Wait for completion and restart if required

Check Windows Event Viewer for QuickBooks-related errors

Verify company file integrity using QuickBooks File Doctor

Last Resort - Reinstallation:

Uninstall QuickBooks completely through Control Panel

Clean residual files and registry entries

Reinstall QuickBooks Enterprise 24.0 from clean download

Restore company file and test functionality

QuickBooks Export Issues (Reports to Excel)

Remote Troubleshooting :

Test exporting different report types to isolate issue

Check if Microsoft Office/Excel is properly installed and licensed

Repair Microsoft 365 installation:

Go to Apps and Features

Find Microsoft 365/Office

Click Advanced Options → Repair

Choose Quick Repair first, then Online Repair if needed

Restart both QuickBooks and Excel after repair

Test export functionality again

If repair fails:

Update both QuickBooks and Microsoft 365 to latest versions

Check for conflicting Excel add-ins

Test exporting to different file formats (CSV, PDF)

Escalation:

Complex multi-user database corruption issues

Server-level QuickBooks configuration problems

Enterprise licensing or activation issues

Common Causes: 

QuickBooks Not Opening:

Recent QuickBooks updates causing compatibility issues

Incorrect installation configuration (single vs multi-user)

Corrupted program files or Windows system files

Server connectivity issues in multi-user environments

Export Issues:

Microsoft Office installation corruption

Version compatibility between QuickBooks and Excel

Missing or corrupted Excel components

Office licensing issues

title: VPN not working
content:
Remote Troubleshooting :

Test VPN connection and note specific error messages

Flush DNS cache to clear potential conflicts:

Open Command Prompt as administrator

Run: ipconfig /flushdns

Restart VPN connection attempt

Verify VPN client settings and credentials

Check if other internet connectivity works without VPN

Test VPN connection from different network (mobile hotspot)

If remote steps fail - Advanced Configuration:

Check VPN protocol settings:

Enable MS-CHAP v2 authentication if available

Verify encryption settings match server requirements

Re-enter Pre-Shared Key (PSK):

Delete existing PSK and re-type carefully

Ensure no extra spaces or characters

Update VPN client software to latest version

Check Windows Firewall and antivirus blocking VPN traffic

Verify correct server address and port settings

If configuration fails - Network-Level Troubleshooting:

Restart router/modem at user location:

Power cycle network equipment

Wait for full reconnection before testing VPN

Test different VPN protocols (OpenVPN, IKEv2, L2TP)

Verify network adapter settings and drivers

Escalation to L3:

VPN server configuration issues

Complex network routing problems

Corporate firewall blocking VPN traffic

VPN server hardware or licensing problems

Common Causes:

DNS cache conflicts preventing connection

Incorrect authentication settings (MS-CHAP v2 disabled)

Corrupted or incorrect Pre-Shared Key

Router/ISP blocking VPN protocols

Outdated VPN client software

Network adapter driver issues

Corporate firewall restrictions

title: Shared drive not working
content:
Remote Troubleshooting:

Test if shared drive is accessible through file explorer

Check if other network resources are working (internet, email)

Restart the affected computer and test drive access again

Verify mapped drive letters and UNC paths are correct

Test accessing shared drive using IP address instead of server name

Check if user has proper permissions to access the shared folder

If remote steps fail - Network Diagnostics:

Run network diagnostics from Command Prompt:

Execute: ipconfig /all and document DNS settings

Try: ping [server-name] and ping [server-IP]

Flush DNS cache: ipconfig /flushdns

Reset network adapter: ipconfig /release then ipconfig /renew

Escalation to L3:

DNS configuration issues requiring server-side changes

Network infrastructure problems beyond local computer

Server-side shared folder permission problems

Common Causes:

Computer network connection issues resolved by restart

DNS configuration problems preventing server name resolution

Incorrect mapped drive settings or paths

Network credentials expired or corrupted

Server-side DNS settings requiring L3 adjustment

Domain trust relationship issues

Network adapter driver problems

title: Printer setup
content:
Step 1: Physical Setup

Unpack printer and place in designated location

Add asset tag to printer (label with company asset number)

Connect power cable and turn on printer

Step 2: Network Connection

Connect printer to network:

Ethernet: Connect cable to available network port

Wireless: Configure WiFi through printer's display panel

Note printer's MAC address from network settings

Step 3: Configure DHCP Reservation

Access RM (Router Management/DHCP server)

Set DHCP reserved IP: 177.89 for this printer

Use printer's MAC address to create reservation

Save configuration changes

Step 4: Test and Configure

Verify printer receives the reserved IP address (177.89)

Install printer drivers on test computer

Add printer using the reserved IP address

Print test page to confirm functionality

Step 5: Documentation

Update asset management system (TARPIT) with printer details

Update ticket as completed

title: Laptop setup
content:
Step 1: Initial Setup

Apply asset tag to laptop 

Install fresh Windows 11 Pro operating system

Complete initial Windows setup and configuration

Step 2: User Account Creation

Create local user account for the assigned user

Set appropriate user permissions and password policy

Configure user profile settings

Step 3: Office 365 Installation

Install Microsoft Office 365 suite

Configure email account in Outlook

Test email send/receive functionality

Verify all Office applications launch properly

Step 4: OneDrive Setup

Install and configure OneDrive for Business

Sign in with user's Microsoft 365 account

Test file sync functionality

Configure sync settings as needed

Step 5: Security Software

Install CWA ESET antivirus software

Configure security settings and policies

Run initial system scan to verify functionality

Ensure real-time protection is active

Step 6: Updates and Drivers

Install all Windows updates

Update laptop drivers (network, graphics, audio, etc.)

Verify all hardware components are working properly

Restart and test system stability

Step 7: Final Testing

Test all installed software and functionality

Verify network connectivity and internet access

Update asset management system with laptop details

Document completion in ticket system

title: New user account setup
content:
Step 1: Create Email Account

Access Microsoft 365 admin center

Create new user account with appropriate email address

Set temporary password and require password change on first login

Assign necessary Microsoft 365 licenses

Step 2: Configure SharePoint Access

Verify user has access to their designated SharePoint site

Add user to appropriate SharePoint groups/permissions

Test access by logging in as the user

Step 3: User Notification

Contact new user via phone or email

Provide new email address and temporary password

Explain they must change password on first login

Step 4: Documentation

Update ticket with completion status

Document any additional setup performed

Confirm user can access all required systems

title: VPN setup
content:
Step 1: Get Approval

Verify request is authorized

Get explicit approval before proceeding with setup

Step 2: Create VPN User

Access VPN server admin panel

Create new VPN user account for the user

Generate secure credentials (username/password)

Apply appropriate VPN permissions/group settings

Step 3: Run Configuration Script

Execute the premade PowerShell script (ps1 file)

Script will configure VPN client settings automatically

Verify script completed without errors

Step 4: Add CNAME Record

Access DNS management console

Add CNAME record for VPN connection

Verify DNS propagation

Step 5: Test VPN Connection

Test VPN connectivity from test device

Verify user can connect and access required resources

Confirm internet access works through VPN

Step 6: User Notification & Documentation

Call/email user with VPN credentials and setup instructions

Update Passportal with new VPN user information and credentials

Update ticket as completed

title: Password reset
content:
Password Reset Process

Ask permission - Get user confirmation for changing it

Go to settings - Access admin portal and reset password

Notify customer securely - Call with new password and confirm access



Security Considerations:

Never send passwords via unsecured email

Always require password change for temporary passwords

Verify user identity before providing new credentials
